content.question:
In anaphase <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of meiosis, cohesion between the centromeres of sister chromatids is maintained while homologous chromosomes migrate to opposite poles of the cell along the meiotic spindle as represented in Figure 1.

Figure 1. Migration of homologous chromosomes during anaphase <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of meiosis

A compound that prevents the separation of the homologous chromosomes in anaphase <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is being studied. Which of the following questions can be best answered during this study?

choices.label: Will the cells produced at the end of meiosis still be genetically identical to each other in the presence of this compound?
Will the long-term development of the individual be affected by this meiotic error?

When do the centrosomes start to move apart during meiosis <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> as compared to meiosis <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?
Is there a pattern to the movement of homologous chromosomes in the presence of this compound?

content.answer: Is there a pattern to the movement of homologous chromosomes in the presence of this compound?

skill.text: 3.A: Identify or pose a testable question based on an observation, data, or a model.
